block.p: Deborah Ann Malloy, a daughter of Vivien and Harry Malloy of Waccabuc, N.Y., was married on Dec. 9 to Hans Gunther Winkler, the son of the late Paul and Emmi Timm Winkler. A registrar officiated at the town hall in Katzenelnbogen, Germany.

Mrs. Malloy-Winkler is an equestrian who competes in show jumping in Europe. Her father is a vice president of Bain Hogg Robinson, insurance brokers in New York. He and the bride's mother own Edition Farm in Waccabuc, where they own and breed thoroughbreds.

Deborah Ann Malloy, a daughter of Vivien and Harry Malloy of Waccabuc, N.Y., was married on Dec. 9 to Hans Gunther Winkler, the son of the late Paul and Emmi Timm Winkler. A registrar officiated at the town hall in Katzenelnbogen, Germany.

Mrs. Malloy-Winkler is an equestrian who competes in show jumping in Europe. Her father is a vice president of Bain Hogg Robinson, insurance brokers in New York. He and the bride's mother own Edition Farm in Waccabuc, where they own and breed thoroughbreds.
The bride's grandfather the late Andrew Goodman was the chairman and president of Bergdorf Goodman, which her great-grandfather Edwin Goodman helped to found.

Mr. Winkler is an equestrian who as a member of West Germany's show jumping team won gold medals in the 1956, 1960, 1964 and 1972 Olympics. He owns a stable of show jumping horses in Warendorf, Germany, and is the president of H.G.W. Marketing, which arranges sponsorships for show jumping competitions in Europe. His father was a riding instructor. The bridegroom's three previous marriages ended in divorce. WEDDINGS
